#define rot(a)  mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))

                r = sign(q.x)*q - vec3(3,0,-3)*vec3(.7+.3*sin(T)),                                           \
                t = min(t, max( 1.-r.z, length(r.xy) - .4 )),  /* arm */                  \
                t = min(t, length( vec2(length(r.yz) - 1., abs(abs(r.x)-.4)-.2)) - .2 ) // 4 rings "fingers" 
  
void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) {
    
    float t=10., d;
    vec3  R = iResolution, T=R-R,
          D = normalize(vec3( U+U, -10.*R.y ) - R ),  // ray direction
          p = 50./R, q,r;                             // marching point along ray 
    O-=O;
    for ( O++; O.x > 0. && t > .01 ; O-=.015 )
        q = p, 
        q.yz *= rot(.6),                              // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-.3*iTime),
        
        T=3.*iTime+vec3(1.57,0,0),P( q ),                 // P(-q ),            // shape with 4 rotations 
        T=3.*iTime+vec3(0,0,1.57),P(vec3(-q.z,q.y, q.x)), // P(vec3( q.z,q.y,-q.x)), 
        
        p += t*D;                                     // step forward = dist to obj

    O *= vec4(.8,.8,1.,1);                             // coloring
}

void mainImage( out vec4 O, vec2 u )
{

       dt = .1,                                      // blur span
        r = 1.,                                      // fading prev frames
        t = mod(iTime, 3.);                          // render mode
  if (t<1.) T = 1., dt = 0., r=.1;                   // 0: multisampling off, fading on 
                                                     // 1: multisampling on,  fading off          
  else if (t>2.)  r=.1;                              // 2: multisampling on,  fading on          
 
  for(float k=0.; k++ < T; ) {                       // add rays of different time
    float i = 0., d = 1., 
          t = 10.*( iTime + dt*hash(u,k) ),          // jitter time
          c = .3;                                    // sphere radium
      
    vec3 N, L = n(vec3(1,2,-1)),                     // set scene
         D = n( vec3( 2.*u - R, R.y ) +.1 ), P = D-D,// ray dir and pos
         C = vec3(0,0,2)+ cos(t)*vec3(1,0,0) + sin(t)*vec3(0,.5,.87); // sphere center

    for(; i++ < 99. && d > 1e-3; P += d*D )          // ray march
        d = length(P-C) - c;                         // distance to sphere surface
    
    N = n(P-C);                                      // normal
    O += i>99. ?   vec4(0,.5,1,0)                    // noHit
               : ( .1 + .8* d(N,L) *vec4(1,0,0,0) + .8* pow( d(N,n(L-D)), 40.) ) // Phong
                 * 3.; // compensate overtransparency due to exaggerated blur
  }
  O = mix( T(u), O/T, r);                            // slow fading
}

    O = vec4(1);
    mat2 M = mat2(1,-1,1,1);                         // for 45° rotations
    vec2 R = iResolution.xy,
         U = 3. * ( 2.*u - R ) / 360. + iTime,
